rev.comment: removed old problems and unsourced ones: wikipedia is not the place to list all the bugs
rev.diff:
Line 61: Line 61:
==Issues==
==Issues==
â
FDM had been reported on the Mozilla [[Bugzilla]] as crashing Mozilla [[Mozilla Firefox#Version 3.0|Gran Paradiso]], but this has been resolved.<ref> {{cite web|url=https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=354624 |title=right click on any page will crash firefox with free download manager extension |accessdate=2008-01-23 }}</ref>
  â   â
FDM has a few non-critical issues when running under [[Windows Vista]].{{Fact|article|date=November 2007}}
  â   â
Previous distributions of the software contained a file called FUMOEI.EXE which was sometimes flagged as malware<ref> {{cite web|url=http://www.freedownloadmanager.org/fdmpolicy.htm |title=Free Download Manager Policy |accessdate=2008-01-23 }}</ref> because its filename was identical to a known spyware program. The filename was an unfortunate choice by the developers and has been changed in the latest releases. FUMOEI was related to integration with Microsoft Outlook Express. <ref> {{cite web|url=http://www.freedownloadmanager.org/board/viewtopic.php?t=9182 |title=FUMOEI in FDM |accessdate=2008-01-23 }}</ref>
  â  
As of version 2.5, FDM cannot download files larger than 2 gigabytes while using a secure [[HTTPS]] connection. <ref> {{cite web|url=http://www.freedownloadmanager.org/board/viewtopic.php?t=10188 |title=Cannot Download Large Files via HTTP (with authentication)! |accessdate=2008-08-02 }}</ref>
As of version 2.5, FDM cannot download files larger than 2 gigabytes while using a secure [[HTTPS]] connection. <ref> {{cite web|url=http://www.freedownloadmanager.org/board/viewtopic.php?t=10188 |title=Cannot Download Large Files via HTTP (with authentication)! |accessdate=2008-08-02 }}</ref>
